Health in Kenya
is very poor, so many families with
irregular incomes cannot
afford it. Therefore, the local community has
implemented a very meaningful project to help
people reduce the cost of medical examination at the
hospital.
Bin care, a community-based enterprise,
specializes in providing home health services,
including basic health care training
for patients such as
bed bath instructions, medication control,
and blood pressure measurement.  A nurse from bin
came to the house to take care of an 85
year old woman with dementia. I took my mother
to the hospital many times and it was quite expensive.
Blood sugar levels When medical staff train
patients' families, they will only visit the patient's home
once a week and charge a fee of 5
USD, thereby saving people nearly
half the cost of going to the hospital.
During the past five years, we have always tried
to reduce the cost of medical examinations, especially for
households in rural areas whose
family members can have clinical examinations
in the comfort of their own home according to
WHO data in 2022.  5.1 million of Kenya's population is just
